meanings.definition: To strike with a heavy blow or impact.
meanings.sent1: He was whamming the nail into the wall with a hammer.
meanings.sent2: The boxer was whamming his opponent with powerful punches.
meanings.sent3: The chef was whamming the dough to make it perfectly flat.
meanings.sent4: The storm was whamming against the windows, making them rattle.
meanings.sent5: The giant was whamming his club on the ground, causing tremors.

meanings.sent1: The whamming of the gavel signaled the end of the trial.
meanings.sent2: The whamming of the door echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent3: The whamming of the drum added energy to the music.
meanings.sent4: The whamming of the waves against the shore was calming.
meanings.sent5: The whamming of the falling tree could be heard from afar.
